We are as ready as we'll ever be.

Do you have a plan?
Be first to the weapon
English: destroy it or neutralize it. Take control of the army

I need you all here. Once I give the signal

When you've returned last year

LANGUAGE: Thank you
Comment: for everything. We wouldn't be standing here without your intervention. I said it before

Comrades

Let us show them true power. The world will not be the same when the sun rises tomorrow!
Onwards
English: to the facility! One last step

column4: in our path to final victory!

Seize the weapon

Comment: please.

You must have lost your mind

English: we are kept in the blind. Is that so that the party can sacrifice us to start the next big war?

We are just pawns in all of this. I couldn't care less if only I knew my loved ones are safe. But we can't be sure Europe is not already burning.
Nikolay
English: we are at the edge of the world. We don't affect the global politics at all
Comment: we are too insignificant for that. Surely

LANGUAGE: You can't be sure
Comment: because you don't know. We have no idea.

LANGUAGE: I don't trust this secrecy
English: I truly don't. I know something is not right and I fear what comes next.

LANGUAGE: Let me talk to Belsky
English: clear this out. You seem really stressed by it.

LANGUAGE: Don't
Comment: don't talk...

LANGUAGE: Hello
Comrade Lemontov!
At ease
English: comrade. I would like to have a private word with comrade Rashiv.

LANGUAGE: By all means
Comment: I'm already gone!

LANGUAGE: What do you want
To talk. That's all.
I've been trying to talk to you for weeks to no avail.
I am sorry about that
English: but I had my reasons. Can we go somewhere more private?

LANGUAGE: What if I don't care what you have to say anymore?
I am about to take part in the final assault - it is going decide it all
English: change things forever. I may not come back.

LANGUAGE: I owe you answers. Please
Comment: follow me.

LANGUAGE: Lead the way.
Is this private enough?
You still don't realize how dangerous the situation is.
I don't have much reason. We are on Malden and the world is still intact.
We are about to strike at the small island to the east - that is where this war is going to be decided.
That's where you're going to save the world?
Your sarcasm is unnecessary. I'm serious
I was also serious when I asked you not to kill the rebels.
Is that the sole reason you are angry with me?
One of many.
-- Saved the rebels
You should know there's the general truth that people believe
English: the course of events I wanted to be known.

LANGUAGE: And then there are the facts
Comment: of what truly transpired. You should rest well for your rebels are all safe and sound.

LANGUAGE: What is that bullshit?
Don't you see
English: Sergey? I needed to prove myself to Volkov by doing his bidding.

LANGUAGE: If there was no other way I would have killed them per my orders - too much is at stake to make mistakes. Fortunately
English: I did find a way for them to live.

LANGUAGE: Do you think I'll believe that? Nobody has seen them since.
I'm no amateur
English: Sergey. If you don't trust my word
Comment: then we have nothing more to discuss on this matter.

LANGUAGE: Do know that you should know all parts of the equation before passing judgment.
-- Killed the rebels
You should understand my position - I needed to prove myself to Volkov by doing his bidding.
I tried to find a way for them to live
Comment: I couldn't stop the execution from going through.

LANGUAGE: Too much is at stake to make mistakes. It is not something I am proud of
English: but the truth of the matter is that their deaths were necessary for us to stop the threat that is Volkov.

LANGUAGE: I promised them I would bring them peace. But bringing you I signed their death warrants.
My conscience is clear. They were soldiers and in my position they would have not acted differently. Sometimes you have to sacrifice things in order to achieve higher goal.
And our goal is to stop the madness that's about to transpire. It is our duty to see things through.
But that's not what I wanted to talk about.
What is it? Any more enlightening wisdom for you to pass on me?
... more wisdom for you to pass on me?
This is no joke
Comment: hard.

Are you seriously accusing me?

Stop with the theatrics and answer me
No
English: I don't have anything to do with the command centre raid. Happy?

LANGUAGE: Come on

You mean..? What?

Nothing unusual

The whole point of this ordeal might be something you are not yet aware of. Something you might not agree with.
You should keep both your eyes open.

Grigory

By inviting you to our plan

LANGUAGE: But I should have been more forthcoming. I convinced myself that by not telling you about your father that I was somehow easing you the pain.
The truth is
English: I was scared of losing you. In the end

LANGUAGE: You were close to my father
We were friends. He was one of the best men I ever met.
During the war
English: someone was feeding the Americans a lot of information. It led to us getting defeated here on Malden and essentially losing the war.

LANGUAGE: One night on Everon
English: I corneder Stanislav Shaposhnikov. His testimony did not match and I knew he was working for the spy.

LANGUAGE: I forced him to reveal his name - it was your father.
My father was a traitor?
He made sure we lost
English: he made sure that Alexander Livanokh lost. But he was no traitor for we were the traitors.

At the time
English: I was on his side. I didn't know what he was planning. When I learned what Vadim had done

The whole platoon was in it

Sergey

What the fuck

Fuck me for thinking you were different

LANGUAGE: Grigory

It is not fair
